headline.main: THE TENEMENT COMMITTEE.; The Rag-Pickers' Paradise--Barracks that we Read of--Misery, Fifth, &c., &c. HOW THE POOR LIVE IN NEW-YORK.

docs.lead_paragraph: The full Committee, comprising Messrs. Reed, Duganne, Shea, Curtis, and Brevourt, and accompanied by Alderman BRIGGS, Councilman WHITLOCK, Inspector DOWNING, and the Health Wardens of the Eleventh and Thirteenth Wards, took another excursion on Saturday through the delightful avenues of the Eleventh and Thirteenth Wards. The weather was highly favorable to rank odors, and the ??-factory nerves of the party were prepared accordingly.

headline.main: Later from Havana--Arrival of the Steamship Black Warrior.
A Fact Carefully to be Remembered--Food for the Campaign--The Way a Vote was Secured--The English Peace Addresses.

docs.lead_paragraph: EXPOSURE OF A PRETEXT. One fact connected with the Kansas question should be marked distinctly, and carefully remembered, by those whom it most directly concerns: SOLOMON G. HAVEN, GEORGE G. DUNN CO. wanted the Free-State Kansas bill barred in Committee of the Whole, a week ago, because they deemed it important to hear the report of the Kansas Committee of Investigation on before voting on the bill.

headline.main: LATEST INTELLIGENCE; By Telegraph to the New-York Daily Times. Magdetic Telegraph Co.'s Offices--5 Hanover-st., and 181 Broadway. House Printing Telegraph--Office No. 21 Wall-street. FROM WASHINGTON. Probable Adjournment of Congress on the 28th--The British Legation--Increase of Pay in the Army--Gen. Smith Ordered to the Western Departments--The Netherlands Consul and the Keating Murder, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Senate's resolution to adjourn on the 28th July rapidly grows in favor with the Anti-Administration men, and will probably be adopted. The State Department has no information of instructions issued to Mr. LUMLEY, Mr. CRAMPTON'S late Secretary of Legation, to reopen the British Legation in this city, although no doubt is entertained that such a step will be taken by the British Government.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; Ald. Briggs Gnashed at by the Matsell Pound Bull Dog--The Dog Perishes--Briggs Survives, and Stephen H. Branch tells the Solemn Tale. DOG-POISON, CONSPIRACY AND ELQUENCE.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the New-York Daily Times: On Alderman BRIGGS' return from Buffalo, on Wednesday last, (whither he had accompanied Mr. FILLMORE,) he received an invitation to address the citizens of Williamsburg. After he had addressed the great assemblage on Saturday last, and while descending from the rostrum, a gentleman thus introduced himself:

headline.main: VERY INTERESTING FROM KANSAS.; More Illegal Arrests at Lawrence. THREE REMANDED AND FIVE ACQUITTED. Horrible Treatment of Free-State Prisoners at Tecumseh. ANOTHER BOGUS SHERIFF AT WORK. THEIR TRIAL FOR TREASON. OFFICIAL REPORT OF THE TRIAL.

docs.lead_paragraph: I have already told you that eight prisoners (Free-State men) who were arrested near Ossawatomic had been taken to Tecumseh for trial. The trial came off last week, and five of them were released, and are now in town on their way horne. I have learned many interesting facts connected will the affair that should go upon the record.

headline.main: NEWS FROM EUROPE.; MR. PEABODY'S ENTERTAINMENT TO MR. DALLAS. Debates in Parliament on the Dismissal of Mr. Crampton. Diplomatic Intercourse- not to be Interrupted. ARRIVAL OF THE HERMANN AND THE CANADA'S MAILS. OUR RELATIONS WITH GREAT BRITAIN.

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States mail steamship Hermann. from Southampton on the 18th of June, arrived at her dock yesterday morning. The Hermann brings European advices of the same date as those brought by the Nortl America. at Quebec.
docs.snippet: The United States mail steamship Hermann. from Southampton on the 18th of June, arrived at her dock yesterday morning. The Hermann brings European advices of the same date as those brought by the Nortl America. at Quebec.
